Class Point4

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.sgl.Tuple4
      edu.mines.jtk.sgl.Point4

public class Point4
extends Tuple4

A point with four coordinates x, y, z, and w.

Version:
2005.05.19
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

Constructor Detail

Point4

public Point4()
Constructs a point with coordinates (x,y,z) = 0 and w = 1.

Point4

public Point4(double x,
              double y,
              double z)
Constructs a point with specified (x,y,z) coordinates and w = 1.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate.
y - the y coordinate.
z - the z coordinate.

Point4

public Point4(double x,
              double y,
              double z,
              double w)
Constructs a point with specified coordinates.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate.
y - the y coordinate.
z - the z coordinate.
w - the w coordinate.

Point4

public Point4(Point3 p)
Constructs a point from the specified 3-D point. The (x,y,z,w) coordinates of the constructed point are (p.x,p.y,p.z,1).

Parameters:
p - the 3-D point.

Point4

public Point4(Point4 p)
Constructs a copy of the specified point.

Parameters:
p - the point.
Method Detail

homogenize

public Point4 homogenize()
Returns the homogenized point equivalent to this point. Homogenization is division of the coordinates (x,y,z,w) by w.

Returns:
the homogenized point.

homogenizeEquals

public Point4 homogenizeEquals()
Homogenizes this point. Homogenization is division of the coordinates (x,y,z,w) by w.

Returns:
this homogenized point.

plus

public Point4 plus(Vector3 v)
Returns the point q = p+v, for this point p and the specified vector v.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
the point q = p+v.

minus

public Point4 minus(Vector3 v)
Returns the point q = p-v, for this point p and the specified vector v.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
the point q = p-v.

plusEquals

public Point4 plusEquals(Vector3 v)
Moves this point p by adding the specified vector v.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
this point, p += v, moved.

minusEquals

public Point4 minusEquals(Vector3 v)
Moves this point p by subtracting the specified vector v.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
this point, p -= v, moved.

affine

public Point4 affine(double a,
                     Point4 q)
Returns an affine combination of this point p and the specified point q.

Parameters:
a - the weight of the point q.
q - the point q.
Returns:
the affine combination (1-a)*p + a*q.
